g-C3N4 and TiO2 NPs produced over the Ti3C2 layers, resulting in more production of electrons.Due to proficient production of charge carriers, CO2 was effectively converted to CO and CH4 with the involvement of 2 and 8 electrons, respectively.Besides, CO would also be converted to CH4 with the utilization of 6 electrons, resulting in more production of methane.Previously, MoS2 and Ti3C2 MXene as cocatalyst for enhanced photoactivity of TiO2 for photocatalytic hydrogen production has been reported 53.Thus,

during controlled HF etching of Ti3AlC2, TiO2 NPs were produced, thus, it can be activated by the light irradiations, producing electrons and holes.The photogenerated electrons from CB of TiO2 (-0.52 eV) would be transferred towards VB of g-C3N4, enabling their efficient separation.However, this mechanism would be limited compared to g-C3N4 activation due to the presence of only small portion of TiO2 NPs over the Ti3C2 surface.
